channel.title: Does anyone have a fun server source?
channel.description:
anyone out there got a really fun or just fun server source?(besides firescape)
EDIT: can someone post RSCremixx with all the files in it (including the sql)

item.title: Does anyone have a fun server source?
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“ephemeral, post:18, topic:229441”]I think RSCDaemon v. 25 probably is better than any Geminus servers that have yet to be created (even better than MoonSpell), but really, nowadays, I don’t feel expanding on a source that already exists. Rather, I create my own from very scratch (which I am still doing). Mine have pretty much fully working smithing and fletching so far when it comes to skills other than fighting (attack, defence, strength and hits) and prayer.

Why aren’t there anyone else that re-writes their from scratch, except for myself and Sean & eXemplar?

bigh51: You said you know Java pretty well; why not give writing a source from scratch a shot? It is actually fun to see how far you can get…[/quote]I could, but I’m always busy with real life and things such as school. I might give it a try when I’m less busy, but I’ve been busy a lot recently. Also, I’m too lazy to full out make a source/client from scratch, and I’d probably give up because I can’t really commit my time to one thing that I don’t really even fully understand how to do.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have a fun server source?

item.title: Does anyone have a fun server source?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

adu: It is not really that hard…

1). Normally you have to examine the client for its outgoing packets (which packets; according to their ID, when; what action that sends them and how; what ‘data-types’ they use)…

2). Then you need to make a new handler for them (a ‘PacketHandler’ in this case), that reads the proper values in the correct order (referred to as ‘how;…’ in the text above).

3). In the last and final step (before testing), you should make the server reference the handlers for the packets somehow. In most RSC private servers they use an XML file (usually called ‘PacketHandlers.xml’). In this file you should write the fully-qualified package-name (the package-name + class-name put together, and separated with a . (dot)), aswell as the ID (or IDs) of the packets you wish to reference that packet-handler with, together, and follow the used format (there should be others written, so just follow their format).

Note: The first step is not needed anymore (unless you really wish to learn more than C&P), because the ‘protocol’ has already been almost fully documented (the documentation can be found in one of the stickies; at an external site). What I mentioned was more just how you do it in general… A. k. a. ‘reverse-engineering’ (even though reverse-engineering usually involves alot more than that).

I hope that explained enough for you to understand… Good luck!

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have a fun server source?

Rather, I create my own from very scratch (which I am still doing). Mine have pretty much fully working smithing and fletching so far when it comes to skills other than fighting (attack, defence, strength and hits) and prayer.

Why aren’t there anyone else that re-writes their from scratch, except for myself and Sean & eXemplar?

item.title: Does anyone have a fun server source?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I think RSCDaemon v. 25 probably is better than any Geminus servers that have yet to be created (even better than MoonSpell), but really, nowadays, I don’t feel expanding on a source that already exists. Rather, I create my own from very scratch (which I am still doing). Mine have pretty much fully working smithing and fletching so far when it comes to skills other than fighting (attack, defence, strength and hits) and prayer.

Why aren’t there anyone else that re-writes their from scratch, except for myself and Sean & eXemplar?

bigh51: You said you know Java pretty well; why not give writing a source from scratch a shot? It is actually fun to see how far you can get…

item.source: Does anyone have a fun server source?

item.title: Does anyone have a fun server source?
item.dc:creator: @anc13nts1 anc13nts1
item.description:
@anc13nts1 wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:15, topic:229441”][quote author=ephemeral link=topic=301829.msg2423222#msg2423222 date=1220460477]
bigh51: Yes, I totally agree.

extacy: Yeah, maybe someday I will re-release it, but I don’t think anyone will ever use it, seeing as there is RSCDaemon v. 25 around. If someone would, they would hopefully know Java pretty well, because that is a requirement to continue with it (seeing as almost noone even adds great things to the RSCDaemon-based servers around).

Also, yes, I do happen to have a client with v. 135. It is the old Geminus client, which I also have with source. Here it is: http://www.megaupload.com/?d=TR7YYZI7

elyad: Okay, now I got your point… Thanks for elaborating.
[/quote]I know java pretty well and made a great geminus server with lots of things added, but once you’ve coded demonik and rscd v25 you can’t go back to geminus.[/quote]

Naw I use to have “Geminus” first thing I ever started off of I used to have “moonshine” to lol

Read full topic

item.description:
@extacy wrote:

[quote=“ephemeral, post:10, topic:229441”]bigh51: My intentions wasn’t to brag, I just wanted to say that, because it seems as if most people nowadays think that only RSCDaemon-sourced servers exists.

What annoys me most though, is that most people only gives credits to the previous owner (the person(s) who released it last). This when there barely have been added anything to it. But I guess, that won’t change. :)[/quote]

Should re-release moonspell again tbh, and remove the current RSCD v25 to the community. By the way, happen to have a 135MC around by any chance?

item.title: Does anyone have a fun server source?
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“jlsjlsb, post:3, topic:229441”]can you post rscd v25 with the sql files? and all[/quote]RSCD v25 and Firescape won’t work with each other by taking code from one and putting it into the other. You can make the methods and use them from RSCD v25 but then you would need to add other stuff. Basically they’re not backwards compatible. Also RSCD v25 is more like a base to add things, Firescape is more of a pk server.

Read full topic
